availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elijah Gabbert (Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and politician)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and politician. Virginia native. Married to Malinda Gabbert. Farmer in Mercer County in 1850 and 1860. Owned five enslaved people in 1850. Owned two enslaved people in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Mercer County in 1840, from 1853 to 1855, and from 1861 to 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District No. 2; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District No. 2; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District No. 2, p. 26; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District No. 2, p. 3; Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1878), 604; KYR-0001-004-1356; KYR-0362-001-0001; KYR-0001-029-0552.
